3CBB9A90A4D64D60AFBF0C50F2414DED.description: use plurals and past tense consistently

F8C7C75C4E9F4303AF23866A86A72E04.description: begin to use double consonants when necessary

081716E3A7C645B49280F305C4D687F3.description: begin to consider meanings of homophones

6F935F1FA696475D8E8787CAD707D406.description: begin to spell the r-controlled vowels (ir, er, or, ur, ar) with more consistency

0F2EC4AF42B246E18A251414E077FDE3.description: begin to use other vowel combinations (au, aw, ui, oo, oy, oi, ow)

95C0CCFA14DB4574BD7D9C51D71C7199.description: use a range of spelling strategies with independence

14C49F5F18694D15B9FE8F4B92CB962D.description: use meaning and syntax patterns as well as sound cues to spell words

BDAE89EB15D9464891C9BCACB4A8CA67.description: use increasing numbers of accurately spelled high-frequency words

2FCF91653E244DD6B5DEEA460E51B8B3.description: demonstrate an increasing knowledge of spelling patterns and use patterns from simple words to spell more complex multi-syllabic words

E4216C3928AA406A9BE3E73FCD38912E.description: begin to use new paragraphs when starting a new idea/topic

A70A910731AB4DFEA507FF25C8E04D23.description: begin to use quotation marks (simple quote)

BFF901E4063F40339B0AC97528202DF7.description: begin to use apostrophes for singular possessives and contractions

46EA7F77CE5B4AB4A02F2A0B5A587998.description: use compound sentences (two simple sentences combined with a comma and conjunction)

85550499630C43428A9B7B141D25B510.description: edit for end punctuation and capitals

52810A2191CB4EB2AA26959B2ACD328E.description: use a comma in a date and series

F3A14CF032B445DF82915019092FD5D3.description: use capitals for proper nouns (names or places and days/months)

3A7829F968F44199997BF2203A64FA3D.description: demonstrate through writing a connection to audience

03534360326C4CDDB1DC2988A781963D.description: recognize voice through a comprehensive range of texts

CA31720740F4448B95273EA095399DFC.description: begin to demonstrate a unique, energetic voice in writing

4D2C0CFBB4524407AA9CF1E92BBD66DE.description: use a variety of simple and compound sentences

5A3AB951034D4BB7B57C343CCE5A12ED.description: use a variety of sentence beginnings (including people’s names)

2637E06553474DD19BEA8BB9E50C6D64.description: experiment with transitional words (in the morning, later that day, etc.)

738582B206544D8F9C9A80B6C7A1B6F2.description: develop a sense of flow throughout a piece of writing

8A43E5E0D36548F4BCD274FC8A55324F.description: experiment with a sense of flow throughout a piece, experimenting with leads, using sequencing (first, next, then, finally) when appropriate for the text

C5437156E09148108CF4BEFB7B49594E.description: write about specific topics with elaboration

854456628B5947B2A48DED45EDCE43B6.description: publish student-selected final pieces of writing that demonstrate grade-level traits and conventions

CD92F85B4E134441AEDCB489E6076980.description: conduct a final reread of their draft before publishing

5EC33960CE8D44918B9796F725ED2091.description: use a co-created anchor chart of proofreading strategies

B119109D4534487E9EB56DA19FA03B3D.description: use self-editing checklists to edit for grade-level conventions

C87425946D984C4FB3EFC843429BDB05.description: use the word wall and personal spelling references to check high-frequency words

9BC3E903B24F417E9F11F3978C6D356C.description: make changes to writing to clarify meaning through strategies, such as crossing out words, inserting words using a caret, adding details, and replacing overused words (e.g., said, good, like)

4DDF92C634B24811B2294F822C116E8B.description: reread their writing to monitor meaning and message

59DE37135CD84A5C8E899AAC82CDBFC2.description: write on a single topic, with a beginning, middle, and end; some elaboration and organization

E51A07E57D0B4719A7638D202A270419.description: recognize that writing is reflective of prewriting

4C7A58AB7A734BF0A9C264F516E0134B.description: create jot notes for research writing

A83F8514B64F48E286654B1658A61B7D.description: choose, use, and create simple graphic organizers (such as the five-finger plan, story map, web, list, five Ws, and graphic organizers for specific forms of writing.)

3A3389AB651C4B32B93AD1D4E1A7A929.description: draw pictures to develop ideas for writing

FAFD3A0C9674488D83F3E4C22756C53B.description: talk about the ideas they plan to write about

908B5B88254C49F7A4D1F924880DDBA5.description:
Learners will use a range of strategies to develop effective writing and media
products to enhance their clarity, precision and effectiveness. (CZ, COM, CI, CT,
TF)

A2F16FF0FDE44D0A9259E1D336FE2231.description: use role plays to convey meaning (other ways of representing)

B5A10A94C0BC471ABC5620D83C5D2578.description: work with a partner, in small groups and independently, to create writing

B4BF8F8B64FE414FB2EEDD9A8DFA7851.description: include information that is relevant and purposeful for an intended audience

149D9A9ED01646ACB6AF695DCCCB0FEB.description: choose forms of writing that are appropriate to specific purposes and audiences (e.g., narrative, expository, descriptive, and persuasive)

C978504D341E4215970ED89081ABC78B.description:
Learners will create text including digital collaboratively and independently using a
variety of forms for a range of audiences and purposes. (CZ, COM, CI, CT, TF)

2D976EB70E524E15A565295C2BD8B9AC.description: begin to make their own print and digital graphic organizers to plan their writing

70401F95D8F44D4180A2A8472F82DF78.description: select appropriate print and digital graphic organizers from several options

B350AF2B6D2849969E9D76ABC41CA6DF.description: write an organized text with a beginning, middle, and end; write an effective lead, write a descriptive middle, write a satisfying conclusion

176D150DCB3D4CCE98403ED68AAE8E54.description: create and record higher level questions both in print and/or digital format

A618A2E7A74844EAA39DF14691C2455F.description: write with attention to descriptive detail and word choice (e.g., about a character)—concrete nouns, adjectives, adverbs, precise verbs, description, etc.

CCDDB25389BA4BE5BAFE3FB4E42CDF11.description: explain the purpose for their writing

79F632A5AAA04880B08D36A9D29891F0.description: write a variety of poetry, fiction and non-fiction texts

7B4F29C524434B759A04B2240D9C4DCB.description:
Learners will use writing and other forms of representing including digital to
explore, clarify and reflect on their thoughts feeling and experiences and learnings.
(CZ, COM, CI, CT, TF)

CB4DDA554E924DB5B0AB705BB20EFBCE.description: understand and apply readers’/listeners’ comments to clarify meaning

249EA470F595489E961A61A062D69763.description: label and define drawings to explain ideas/topics

193971E700174C4ABFCA4BBEC37D1FC8.description: express ideas in complete thoughts using simple, compound, and complex sentences

C12954A5508344D3BC72D092E52B626E.description:
Learners will convey meaning by creating print and digital texts collaboratively and
independently using imagination, personal experiences, and feelings.
(CZ, COM, CI, CT, TF)

35DE8FCB06324462ACBD8D16F371D547.description: identify examples of stereotyping, bias, or prejudice

DCC21B6FD6A54157B1F37726CE27E629.description: give opinions about information in or message of a print and/or digital text based on a personal point of view

BB69AB486F7A4B5F9B8B9A782DF9D46C.description: identify and use text features of fiction and non-fiction texts that support comprehension

4C3E33589C5249C59312D4FC4CBD1D08.description: identify the point of view of the author of print and/or digital text

CBCB1A0944BB448BA5684AAB53EAFE61.description: ask critical thinking questions such as, Who/What group is included/considered/ represented in this text?

D94C15F7095D46F68B118B21C62E460D.description: share their opinions about the print and/or digital text and give reasons for those opinions in a variety of multicultural contexts

A450175254784FB39C63575ABCE0CCFB.description: share their connections orally and/or in writing

CC903CDBA0E44DF493D2E9E6A9972662.description: make meaningful personal connections that enhance comprehension

AEDB1F486CC64F30B67B6F9DC1B8D2EF.description:
Learners will respond personally and critically to a range of culturally diverse texts.
(CZ, COM, CI, CT, TF)

3CB8A333C0AD4D3EB514278B4945E923.description: discuss how they researched and found answers to their questions

48801E2AEFF84BEEA1A02BCE0614A305.description: use key words in a search engine to locate information electronically

C9B50E578929409093C672254FD91F13.description: generate higher-level thinking questions (“in the head” versus “in the text”)

F6F16376A6B84537B8845BA48670F807.description: use a table of contents and index (print) and navigation menus (digital) to locate information

D357E2906980409ABE6100C457F3AE84.description: formulate questions to guide their research

F87B03BBFACE46C79499EDD915A07375.description:
Learners will select, interpret, and combine information in multicultural contexts.
(CZ, COM, CI, CT, TF)

1CB98284F46443D5BC07199D7DD218D3.description: change expression for dialogue when signaled by words such as "screamed," "whispered," and murmured

0C3DCBA77C4B461BA6123618CBA7AC6D.description: chunk words into phrases to sound like talking

92FD6A3F088840F19FB58D1961513684.description: change the rate of reading depending on the mood of the text

F639509A19C34C9E940BFD917A9980AE.description: uses punctuation marks effectively to convey meaning

71844764A0D0480BB8CF03870C0913F3.description: explain how a non-fiction text is usually illustrated (photographs) versus a fiction text (drawings) *being mindful of interests, background knowledge, and level

4609DC97C99647D186639A63769F0CF5.description: select just-right* texts for independent reading

BA390F8A966D4D1780AC2C2A1CD96105.description: talk about what makes a text just right* for them

19D55C80541F40E4AE2DD36D8E5A493A.description: (information text, biography, procedural text), and poetry

AC14E4B36EAC44E481484FE1DAA4938D.description: growing range of genres—narrative (realistic fiction, adventure, mysteries, etc.), non-fiction

9D6D9B3028E64C04B6A4D8C487B7D2F6.description: use before-, during-, and after-reading strategies with culturally relevant text

FF3271B0EA324EA29EAED7F580E9C4E9.description: complete reading graphic organizers about their understanding of culturally relevant texts

A52F97B155394D108CC8F06DF96A335E.description: talk about how using comprehension strategies enhanced their understanding

C50220FA518C45A4962D528733AC933E.description: discuss how prior knowledge supports comprehension of culturally relevant text

2F82F5DC7AE94BFFBF15284D1EE4870F.description: infer meaning within and beyond a variety of texts

EE2204B8FA0349F28C163BB85DC4E85F.description: visualize, to support comprehension, with a variety of culturally relevant texts

6411DF4FBB6045ABB853831AA30A2AFD.description: demonstrate comprehension—thinking within, thinking about, and thinking beyond the text

8F87F5C92F194E82A031FB6D3278AB8A.description: talk about text with reference to titles, authors, and illustrators

7A83244B1505484AB68D189390F88E06.description: explain orally and/or in writing their understanding of and reactions to fiction, non-fiction, and poetry texts they are reading

85A6E7CDC5394BB38AA835477F964B60.description: retell a narrative, making reference to vocabulary such as characters, problem, solution

08798D13AE7C4057BE76F18FF2FD077A.description: use picture cues to support understanding

72C2D538EB13450F963427D6B06A813F.description: View with Understanding (Print and Digital Text)

353545ED6EC8469698FE8B3667F2FF6B.description: use text features to gather information and support comprehension (captions, diagrams, maps) read texts with understanding, at level P or beyond, through a variety of genres

1A487E0E1CF446DEBADAB0A8BBAE879C.description: use punctuation to appropriately guide reading such as pausing, and use of inflection to support comprehension and fluency

57FDADA7239F42CDAB0E3DD966C66658.description: apply a variety of word-solving strategies

183C18ADE95A4550B783852B4303327F.description: monitor and self-correct quickly, confidently, and independently with automaticity

AB35CF092CB743CD9A762F8566C94E6B.description: use all sources of information (meaning, structure, visual) to search, monitor, check, and self correct)

42D0803343AC4ABD874A0392F39D2F11.description:
Learners will demonstrate a variety of ways to comprehend and select from a
range of culturally diverse texts. (CZ, COM, CI, CT, TF)

A44CCC4B12FA4A8A8CB9DAEADA4092A7.description: use established courtesies and conventions of conversation in group work and co-operative play situations with consideration for audience and purpose

D6F67D75607A48019E23BA7E3082C2D7.description: use different kinds of language as appropriate to audience and purpose

806B2BDC30644EA7B18B738024977C68.description: use thoughtful, respectful, and non-hurtful vocabulary, considering audience and purpose, and begin to make vocabulary choices that affirm sensitivity to the personal ideas and experiences of others

2E8733E3A064452393EDD5F6FE3D9870.description: choose when and where to use intonation, tone, and expression to communicate ideas and feelings in selected small- and whole-group situations

707C6115D3C144CBABE887FE11524BC7.description: use social conventions (turn-taking, politeness, when to speak, and when to listen) in a range of conversations and co-operative play situations, in multiple cultural contexts

B3866A50FCBD408890B885B59B456BDC.description: respond to and give directions that are multi-step with increased complexity

20384B0B6FFF4287B8BCB3C394C29596.description: use complex sentences that incorporate rich vocabulary and transition words to connect phrases

B0CC6D1D9FF947E7A149AC672A373ADF.description: demonstrate comprehension of oral language by engaging in, responding to, and reflecting upon informal and formal oral presentations with sensitivity and respect, considering audience and purpose

39A54E610E2F42B9B1604380AFED7FDE.description: use intonation, expression, and tone in small- and whole-group interactions that contribute to conversation

4310F0F7EE3741F5BB2946356D395498.description: express and explain opinions, and respond to questions and reactions of others

C2410CE2773C489A9CB5A64F131FB876.description: describe a personal experience in sequential order, and offer an opinion about a topic with at least three supporting details Note to Teacher: Be mindful of different communication styles

FDB9F324D80841A192738288460EE1FB.description: ask and respond to questions to seek clarification of others’ ideas to consolidate information

D4570BB16B7B437DAE1E4E3168FDA8B0.description: demonstrate effective active listening habits (skills) in keeping with the student’s cultural context

A6ED0CE26D804610A4AC61063EE922A4.description: Learners will interact using effective oral language skills considering audience, purpose, and situation. (CZ, COM, CI, CT, TF)
